title: The Easiest Ways to Create Space Buns

steps.title: Brush your hair and part it down the middle.
steps.content: Brush your hair and part it down the middle. Comb your hair until it’s smooth and free of any knots or tangles. Use the handle of a rat-tail comb to create a part running down the center of your head from your forehead to your nape. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Create 2 pigtails.
steps.content: Create 2 pigtails. You can make them high on the top of your head, or you can make them low on either side of your nape—experiment with what you like best here. Smooth down the hair going into the pigtails so that they’re nice and neat. Secure the pigtails with hair ties that match your hair color. [2] X Research source Feel free to leave some strands around your forehead loose for a softer touch.

steps.title: Tease your pigtails if you want more volume.
steps.content: Tease your pigtails if you want more volume. Lift your first pigtail and run a comb through it a few times, starting at the tips and finishing at the hair tie. Repeat this for the second pigtail too. This is a great idea if you have thin hair, as it will make your hair appear thicker and give you larger space buns in the end. [3] X Research source Alternatively, wrap 3-comb hair extensions around the base of your pigtails instead. This will help give you a little more volume. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Twist your first pigtail into a rope.
steps.content: Twist your first pigtail into a rope. Take 1 of your pigtails, and twist it away from your face to create a rope. The tighter you twist the rope, the sleeker and smaller your bun will turn out. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Coil the rope into a bun, then secure it with a hair tie.
steps.content: Coil the rope into a bun, then secure it with a hair tie. Wrap the rope around the base of the pigtail. Make sure that you wrap it away from your face, not towards it. Tuck the end of your hair under the bun, then wrap another hair tie around the base of the bun. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the process for the second bun.
steps.content: Repeat the process for the second bun. Twist the second pigtail into a rope, then coil it into a bun. Tuck the ends of the rope under the bun, then secure it with a hair tie.

steps.title: Adjust the shape of your buns (if desired).
steps.content: Adjust the shape of your buns (if desired). To make the buns messier or more voluminous, gently tug on the outer edges to loosen the strands. For even more volume, gently tug on the hair going into the buns to loosen it up. Focus on the hair on the top and sides of your head. If you left strands out of your buns, consider straightening them with a flat iron . Give them a wispier look by curving the iron towards your face rather than straight down.

steps.title: Secure the buns with hairspray and bobby pins.
steps.content: Secure the buns with hairspray and bobby pins. If the buns feel loose, secure them with bobby pins , using as many as you need. Once you are happy with your style, mist it with hairspray and let the product dry. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Brush your hair and create a center part.
steps.content: Brush your hair and create a center part. Comb your hair so that it is nice and smooth. Use the handle of a rat-tail comb to create a part in the middle of your head. Start the part at your forehead and finish it at the nape. Drape the left half of your hair over your left shoulder, and the right half over the right. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Pull 1 half of your hair into a loose bun to keep it out of the way.
steps.content: Pull 1 half of your hair into a loose bun to keep it out of the way. Take the right half of your hair, and secure it with a hair tie—feel free to do a loose bun or even a pigtail. It does not matter; the goal is to keep this half of your hair out of the way while you work on the other side.

steps.title: Create a half-up ponytail on the left side of your head using a horizontal part.
steps.content: Create a half-up ponytail on the left side of your head using a horizontal part. Create a horizontal part on the left side of your head at about eyebrow level. Start the part at your hairline and finish it at the center part in the back of your head. Pull the hair above the part into a high ponytail and secure it with a hair tie. Instead of making the ponytail in the back center of your head, make it on the top-side of your head, sort of like a puppy ear.

steps.title: Tease your ponytail if you’d like the bun to have more volume.
steps.content: Tease your ponytail if you’d like the bun to have more volume. You are working with less hair than when creating a basic space bun, so it would be a good idea to tease your ponytail a little. Simply lift strands of your ponytail, then backcomb it towards the hair tie with a brush. Teasing can help if your hair is on the thinner, less voluminous side.

steps.title: Twist the ponytail into a bun and secure it with a hair tie.
steps.content: Twist the ponytail into a bun and secure it with a hair tie. Twist the ponytail away from your face to create a rope first. Next, coil the rope around the base of the ponytail to make a bun. Tuck the ends of the rope under the bun, and then wrap a hair tie around the base. The tighter you twist, the smaller and sleeker the space bun will turn out.

steps.title: Undo the temporary bun from the other side and repeat the process.
steps.content: Undo the temporary bun from the other side and repeat the process. Go back to the right side of your head and undo the loose, temporary bun you created earlier. Create another half-up ponytail , tease it, and then wrap it into a bun. Secure the bun with another hair tie.

steps.title: Tease the rest of your hair, if desired.
steps.content: Tease the rest of your hair, if desired. You don't have to do this, but it's a great way to complete the vintage 90s look. Alternatively, if you made your buns nice and sleek, try straightening the rest of your hair instead. For even more volume, pull on the hair going into the buns to loosen it up. Focus on the sides and top of your head. It's okay if the part in the back center of your head goes away at this point. You don't need it anymore.

steps.title: Make any finishing touches, then mist the space buns with hairspray.
steps.content: Make any finishing touches, then mist the space buns with hairspray . If the buns feel loose, secure them to your hair with bobby pins. Once you are happy with the overall look, lightly mist your hair with hairspray. Let the hairspray dry before setting out. These space buns are great if you have shorter hair.

steps.title: Brush your hair, then part it down the middle.
steps.content: Brush your hair, then part it down the middle. Brush out your hair so that it is nice and smooth. Part it down the middle from forehead to nape with the handle of a rat-tail comb. [9] X Research source Braided space buns likely work best on longer hair (or hair that’s long enough to comfortably braid).

steps.title: Pull your hair into 2 pigtails and secure them with hair ties.
steps.content: Pull your hair into 2 pigtails and secure them with hair ties. Feel free to do 2 high pigtails at the top of your head, or 2 low pigtails at the base of your nape. You can even position the pigtails on the sides of your head, just above your ears for a Princess Leia-inspired look. If you want something more intricate, try half-up pigtails instead.

steps.title: Braid the pigtails and secure them with clear hair elastics.
steps.content: Braid the pigtails and secure them with clear hair elastics . Split the first pigtail into 3 equal strands, then cross the left and right strands over the middle strand to create the braid. Once you run out of hair, wrap a clear hair elastic around the end of the braid to secure it. Repeat this step for the other pigtail too. For a more unique look, try a 2-strand rope braid instead. This works especially well for natural hair. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Pull on the outer loops of the braids to volumize them, if desired.
steps.content: Pull on the outer loops of the braids to volumize them, if desired. You don't have to do this, but it's a great way to add volume to your hair, especially if it’s thin. Starting from the bottom of the braid, gently tug on the outer loops until you reach the top, then do the other braid too. Skip this step if you made a 2-strand rope braid. Don't pull too hard, or the braid will come undone.

steps.title: Wrap the braids into buns and secure them with hair ties.
steps.content: Wrap the braids into buns and secure them with hair ties. Pick up the left braid, and wrap it around the hair tie to create a bun. Tuck the end of the braid under the bun, then wrap another hair tie around the base of the bun. Repeat this step for the other braid. Do not twist the braids into a rope like you would with a standard bun.

steps.title: Touch up your hair and mist it with hairspray.
steps.content: Touch up your hair and mist it with hairspray. If the buns feel loose, secure them along the side edges to the rest of your hair, using as many bobby pins as you need. Once you are happy with how your space buns look, mist them with hairspray, and let the hairspray dry. If you did braided half-up buns, consider straightening the rest of your hair for a sleeker look.

steps.title: Messy space buns
steps.content: Messy space buns Brush and part your hair down the middle using a rat-tail comb; then, grab one section of your hair and pull it into a ponytail. As you’re sliding your hair through the elastic for the second time, pull your ponytail out partially rather than all the way. Repeat this process with the rest of your hair. Using the leftover tail of hair on each side, wrap around the base of the bun and tuck the tail tip into the elastic along the backside of each bun. [11] X Research source Pull on the strands in your messy buns to make them seem larger and more voluminous.

steps.title: Low space buns
steps.content: Low space buns Vertically split your hair down the middle, tying off one section to hold it in place. Split the other section into two equal strands and start twisting them around each other; then, coil the twisted hair into a bun shape. Secure this hair in place before repeating the process with the other section of hair that you tied off earlier. [12] X Research source Tug on the hair of your secured bun to make it look even bigger.

steps.title: Natural space buns
steps.content: Natural space buns Split your hair down the center with a rat-tail comb to make even parts. Then, comb each section of hair and treat it with hair growth oil , followed by professional styling oil . Brush each section of hair upwards, securing it with a hair elastic. Wind a second elastic around each section of hair, a little higher up than the base hair tie—this creates a more defined puff of hair. To finish things off, pin down some hair strands from each section to create a more spherical bun. [13] X Research source Use an edge control product on your edges before shaping your buns.

steps.title: Ribbon space buns
steps.content: Ribbon space buns Tie up your space buns as you normally would, securing them in place with hair ties and bobby pins. As an extra touch, tie ribbons around the base of each bun for a stylish touch.
